result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracey M. Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tracey M. Simmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: TC from Ms. Simmons - she was recently fired from her job and has no money to send a payment, also has not completed and returned payment plan application. Ms. Simmons was informed that her fine total is almost $3600 and payments need to be sent in on a regular basis, she again repeated she was fired and couldn't "pull it out of the trees" - the possiblity of a warrant was explained.

ADDRESS INFO for Tracey M. Simmons
Current: 933 A Main Street #D, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-11-2017)
Prior: 1417 Rogers St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Per Traci - remove from calendar; payment plan initiated
Mother came in and made payment of $75/10 - did not have payment plan - gave her another plan to have tracey fill out and fax back ASAP

3:37 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Calling 15cm184, 15ct150, 16cm119, 15cm169, 14tr1775. Defendant moved to Stevens Point. Had 3 jobs and was fired from all 3 jobs - only because she didn't fit in. Starts tomorrow at coffee shop on Main Street in Stevens Point. Not sure where she is going to be living; roommate doesn't like clean people so she is getting kicked out. Court approves $75 monthly payment plan. Court advises of $10 payment plan fee. Payment plan to begin August 1, 2017. Court reiterates payment plan information. Adj. 3:41 p.m.

3:29 pm Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Calling 15cm169, 15cm184, 15ct150, 16cm119, 14tr1775,  Defendant states that she lost job in December and could not find job in Rhinelander - moved to Stevens Point.  Just obtained 2 jobs within walking distance of residence. Court orders defendant to bring paycheck stub to next hearing. Court approves $75 monthly payment at this time to begin April, 2017 - will review at next hearing. Adj. 3:32 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tracey M. Simmons
Current: 1417 Rogers St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2017)
Prior: 5897 W. Highway 8 - A, Rhinelander, WI 54501

3:16 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Calling 15cm169, 15cm184, 15ct150, 16cm119, 14tr1775. Defendant now working at Arby's. Defendant states she can afford $50 per month. Court sets $60 payment plan for now until Defendant's financial status improves. Court will allow community service at a rate of $10 per hour. Defendant to coordinate with PO for speaking at schools and if speaking in school will allow $15 per hour. Court cautions defendant to obtain approval. Court allows first payment to be made January 1, 2017. Adj. 3:21 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court, in custody, via video. Calling 16cm119, 15cm184,15cm169, 14tr1775. Defendant states she works at Arby's 30-35 hours per week; makes $9.50 per hour. Has been making regular monthly payments. Has not missed. Court states she has missed payments. Court sets $100 payment. Court will quash warrants with $25 payment from defendant and $50 payment from mother; defendant will be released after payments are made. Adj. 1:37 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Voluntary appearance on September 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
per Brandi @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
Ms. Simmons lost her employment, but is seeking new employment.  Drop her payment to $50.00 per month.  Should start paying the regular payment after the 1st of the year.

03:04 pm - Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm169 and 15cm184.  Defendant pleads no contest to each count in each case.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig statement to potential victim notification issues.  Michlig/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Fine $705 - Each Count
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

03:06 pm - Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm169 and 15cm184.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:29
Calling 15cm169 and 15cm184
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel - has contacted DA Bednar and meeting with her had to be reset - request adj
Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
may not be on Briar House premises

02:11 pm - Defendant Tracey M. Simmons in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm184 and 15cm169.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.
Will make a payment on March 3rd.
